documents.title: Introduction to RAG
documents.text: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) is a technique that enhances large language models by retrieving relevant information from a knowledge base before generating responses.

documents.title: Chunking Strategies
documents.text: Effective chunking is crucial for RAG systems. Different strategies include fixed-size chunking, semantic chunking, and structural chunking based on document structure.

documents.title: Vector Databases
documents.text: Vector databases store embeddings and enable efficient similarity search. Popular options include PostgreSQL with pgvector, Pinecone, and Weaviate.
